Dear Sam:
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters is
currently engaged in a survey of considerable significance
to educators throughout the United States. In cooperation
with the U.S. Office of Education, the NAEB is surveying and
documenting the ways in which television is being used and
will be used in the future as an instrument of education.
The project is described more fully in the enclosed NAEB
statement.
The field work in the survey has been assigned to a
group of Regional Consultants, including myself. My area
is comprised of Illinois, Indiana, Iowa and Michigan as well
as Wisconsin.
Ideally, I should like to visit each institution or
organization which is active (or planning to be) in ETV.
However, such an extensive schedule of visits will not be
possible in the relatively few weeks in which the work must
be completed.
Southern Regional Education Board
R. EDWIN BROWNE
Director, Broadcasting Services
University of Kansas
RICHARD S. BURDICK

Educational Radio and TV Corp.
Therefore, and with some reluctance, I*ve resorted to a
questionnaire, a copy of which is enclosed. Your response to
the questionnaire, describing your present and contemplated
ETV activities, will help to make this a comprehensive, more
me aningful survey.
JOHN C. CRABBE
Manager
Central California ETV, Inc.
KEITH M. ENGAR
Director, Radio-Television Service
University of Utah
KEITH NIGHBERT
Manager, Station WENH-TV
University of New Hampshire
I will also appreciate your guidance and counsel with
respect to the possible advantage of a personal visit to
your organization, school, or system.
We hope to complete this phase of the survey before
April 1, so that the information may be used as a basis for
the subsequent engineering survey.
